snippet: The oil giant Shell agreed early Wednesday to pay a Nigerian fishing community ending a three-year legal battle in Britain over two spills in 2008 that destroyed mangroves and seafood that had sustained Bodo villagers.
abstract: Shell will pay Nigerian fishing village of Bodo 55 million pounds, or about $83.5 million, for two oil spills in 2008 that ruined thousands of acres of mangroves and seafood.
lead_paragraph: The oil giant Shell agreed early Wednesday to pay a Nigerian fishing community ending a three-year legal battle in Britain over two spills in 2008 that destroyed mangroves and seafood that had sustained Bodo villagers.

headline.main: Nigeria: Shell Agrees to Pay $83.5 Million for Oil Spills
headline.print_headline: Nigeria: Shell Agrees to Pay $83.5 Million for Oil Spills
